# Aufgabe

<!-- Schreiben Sie eine Vorlage für eine prädiktive Analyse mit Tidymodels! -->

Schreiben Sie eine prototypische Analyse für ein Vorhersagemodell mit dem *Lass*.

Hinweise:

- Tunen Sie die Penalisierung
- Verwenden Sie Kreuzvalidierung
- Verwenden Sie Standardwerte, wo nicht anders angegeben.
- Fixieren Sie Zufallszahlen auf den Startwert 42.
- Verwenden Sie den Datensatz `penguins`.
- Modellformel: `body_mass_g ~ .`






</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>

# Lösung


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# 2023-05-14

# Setup:
library(tidymodels)
```

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tictoc)  # Zeitmessung


# Data:
d_path <- "https://vincentarelbundock.github.io/Rdatasets/csv/palmerpenguins/penguins.csv"
d <- read_csv(d_path)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
New names:
Rows: 344 Columns: 9
── Column specification
──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── Delimiter: "," chr
(3): species, island, sex dbl (6): ...1, bill_length_mm, bill_depth_mm,
flipper_length_mm, body_mass_g...
ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. ℹ
Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
• `` -> `...1`
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# drop rows with NA in outcome variable:
d <-
  d %>% 
  drop_na(body_mass_g)

set.seed(42)
d_split <- initial_split(d)
d_train <- training(d_split)
d_test <- testing(d_split)


# model:
mod_lasso <-
  linear_reg(mode = "regression",
             penalty = tune(),
             mixture = 1,
             engine = "glmnet")

# cv:
set.seed(42)
rsmpl <- vfold_cv(d_train)


# recipe:
rec1_plain <- 
  recipe(body_mass_g ~  ., data = d_train) %>% 
  update_role("...1", new_role = "id") %>% 
  step_normalize(all_numeric_predictors()) %>% 
  step_dummy(all_nominal_predictors()) %>% 
  step_impute_bag(all_predictors())


# check:
d_train_baked <- 
  prep(rec1_plain) %>% bake(new_data = NULL)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: There are new levels in a factor: NA
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
na_n <- sum(is.na(d_train_baked))


# workflow:
wf1 <-
  workflow() %>% 
  add_model(mod_lasso) %>% 
  add_recipe(rec1_plain)


# tuning:
tic()
wf1_fit <-
  wf1 %>% 
  tune_grid(
    resamples = rsmpl)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
→ A | warning: There are new levels in a factor: NA
There were issues with some computations   A: x1
There were issues with some computations   A: x2
There were issues with some computations   A: x3
There were issues with some computations   A: x6
There were issues with some computations   A: x9
There were issues with some computations   A: x12
There were issues with some computations   A: x14
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
toc()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
16.245 sec elapsed
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# best candidate:
show_best(wf1_fit)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: No value of `metric` was given; metric 'rmse' will be used.
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 5 × 7
   penalty .metric .estimator  mean     n std_err .config              
     <dbl> <chr>   <chr>      <dbl> <int>   <dbl> <chr>                
1 1.97e-10 rmse    standard    281.    10    12.0 Preprocessor1_Model01
2 4.54e- 9 rmse    standard    281.    10    12.0 Preprocessor1_Model02
3 8.93e- 8 rmse    standard    281.    10    12.0 Preprocessor1_Model03
4 1.75e- 7 rmse    standard    281.    10    12.0 Preprocessor1_Model04
5 1.65e- 6 rmse    standard    281.    10    12.0 Preprocessor1_Model05
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# finalize wf:
wf1_final <-
  wf1 %>% 
  finalize_workflow(select_best(wf1_fit))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: No value of `metric` was given; metric 'rmse' will be used.
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
wf1_fit_final <-
  wf1_final %>% 
  last_fit(d_split)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
→ A | warning: There are new levels in a factor: NA
There were issues with some computations   A: x1
There were issues with some computations   A: x2
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Modellgüte im Test-Set:
collect_metrics(wf1_fit_final)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 2 × 4
  .metric .estimator .estimate .config             
  <chr>   <chr>          <dbl> <chr>               
1 rmse    standard     326.    Preprocessor1_Model1
2 rsq     standard       0.819 Preprocessor1_Model1
```
:::
:::


Man beachte: Für regulierte Modelle sind Zentrierung und Skalierung nötig.
